name: Mixed Bag 42 Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who won the 1945 Best Actress award for 'Mildred Pierce'?
questions.explanation:
Joan Crawford.

	This was an early movie that also had future stars such as Eve Arden, Jack Carson and Zachary Scott in it.

questions.text: What are each of the four sections of a paper clip called?
In the 'Grapes of Wrath', from which state does the Joad family migrate?
questions.explanation:
Oklahoma.

	They migrated from the Oklahoma dust bowl to California in the 1930's. It was written by John Steinbeck.

questions.text: Tulane University is in what city?
questions.explanation:
New Orleans.

	It is coed, founded in 1834. It has a campus of 110 acres.

questions.text: Which of the following colleges/universities is NOT located in Wisconsin?
questions.explanation:
Yale.

	Brown is located in Providence, Rhode Island.

questions.text: Who was killed by the natives at Kealakekua, Hawaii in 1779?
questions.explanation:
Capt. Cook

	Capt. Cook explored the Pacific Ocean and Far East. He arrived in Hawaii on a three masted barque.

questions.text: The American Museum of Science and Energy is in which Tennessee city?
questions.explanation:
Oak Ridge.

	It originally opened in 1949. Its present facility opened in 1975. It is home to the first nuclear reactor.

questions.text: What kind of car was used in the TV show 'My Mother The Car'?
questions.explanation:
Porter.

	It was a 1928 Porter the voice of which was Ann Southern.

questions.text: On what radio program did Major Bowes star?
questions.explanation:
Original Amateur Hour.

	It later became a TV show starring Ted Mack. Many future stars started their careers on that show.

questions.text: In what state did Bonnie and Clyde die?
questions.explanation:
Louisiana.

	Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow were both born in Texas. They died in Arcadia, Louisiana in 1934.
